Reviews.Title: Great pictures....but I expected more
Reviews.Author: D. Gutterud "SDave"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on prior experience with ELPHs and a raving review from the salesperson in the store.  I wish I would have done some research before buying but I had left my other camera in my office and needed to take some photos on a jobsite 4 hours from home.I'll start by saying that it does, for the most part, take very good looking photos in pretty much any situation and in any light.  The zoom is great and the stabilization is actually very good even when zoomed in.  I rarely get fuzzy or out-of-focus shots with this camera.  And the focus is very fast and usually pretty accurate.I actually really like the screen.  It's nice and big and I thought the touchscreen was great once I figured it out.  I will admit that the menus are not set up the way I would have done it but now I kind of know where to go and it works fine.  No, it is not an iPhone/iPad like screen but I think it works well.  If the menu system/software was more intuitive it would be a great way to control the camera.My favorite thing about the touchscreen is moving the focus...one tap and the focus point for the camera can be changed.  Very convenient.I also really like the size and weight - it is small but not too small.  Yes, it is heavier than a lot of cameras in this class but it feels solid and well built.  I like the overall feel.I also like the HDMI out.  This thing takes pretty good videos (including iframe) and the HDMI out is great for sharing them quickly.Now, things I don't like:1) I hate how the photo playback is set up.  It is way more difficult than it should be...especially considering that this is a touch screen.2) Battery life sucks...especially if you want to use WiFi.  If you are going to change to a new style battery why not make it one that packs some power.  These little canisters suck.3) WiFi is a waste of time, battery life and money.  Transfer is PAINFULLY slow and unless you have your camera plugged in you are going to drain your battery by the time the photos are uploaded.  So why have a wireless transfer if you have to plug in for power?  I'll be pulling the card and using my card reader....every time.4) I hate where they put the view photos button..right next to the power button.  Stupid.5) No easy way to force a flash.  You can disable the flash in two taps but there is no easy way to force a flash.  That should be a one step option.  Even "low light" setting doesn't automatically force a flash or give you an option for one.6)  There are many nice "shooting modes" but you can't combine them.  So if you want to do more than one thing you have to go in a manually program.  The "Smart Auto" is actually very good for most situations but when you need to do something special it can take a couple of minutes to get it set up.7) Price.  If this camera worked as well as the marketing materials says it does than the price would be fine.  However, I don't think it lives up to it's billing and, accordingly, is not worth the extra money.Will I keep it?  Yes, because I was too lazy to take it back within the 30 days and because I am now used to it.  The pictures and videos are very good but I still find myself cursing at the camera at least once during each use.Would I buy it again if I could start over?  No.Edit: I bought this camera when it first came out and was $300.00.  At $130.00 this camera is obviously a much better deal.

Reviews.Title: Exactly the compact camera I've been looking for
Reviews.Author: T. Sheridan
Reviews.Content: I have been looking for a good compact camera for a long time. I am an amateur photographer with a Canon 5D and wanted a small camera I could have with me without the weight of the 5D. Any compact I tried suffered from poor quality photos or very slow responsiveness. The time from pressing the shutter release to actual capture of the photo was my biggest issue with using a compact camera for `snapshots.' If I was just trying to capture a moment at a party, the compact's delay was always an issue. So I was stuck with carrying the giant 5D everywhere or missing out on some photo opportunities.The ELPH 530 HS has completely filled my requirements. I spent a few days wandering around my house and yard with both cameras and taking the same shots. The quality of the 530 was almost always up to that of the 5D. The automatic settings are excellent, and even in some tricky backlit situations made the right call on exposure. The only situation where the 5D beat the 530 (but not by much) was in very low light, non-flash situations. So when I'm taking photos in dark churches I will still rely on the 5D, but on almost every other situation the 530 will do nicely.I did not think I would use any of the special effects on the camera but quickly found some useful. When at a dance competition for my daughter I was able to use the color filter function to snap B&W; photos where one color is left in. This was great for shots that made the red of their outfits pop in a sea of gray. I could have done this with the 5D, but would have needed to load the photo on my PC and do some work in photoshop. Instead I had the photos on Facebook within a minute of taking them.That's the other main reason I chose this camera over some others I was looking at, such as the Canon S100 - it has built-in wifi. And it works really well with my iPhone which was my hope for future vacation photos sent from anywhere to friends or posted to Facebook without needing to lug a laptop around. I have not tried the other connections possible from the 530, such as your home wifi to a folder on your pc or to the Canon sharing site. I wanted to be able to get the images to my phone and do what I wanted with them and this works perfectly. When I am home I pop the card into a reader on my PC so I don't see a need to use the home wifi. It seems you need to choose the images individually to save them to your iPhone, but as that is what I normally do I haven't tried to do anything else, such as `send all photos to my iPhone.'The one negative I noticed in other reviews is battery life, and from the perspective of the 5D DSLR, it's very short. I can go all day with the 5D on a single battery, shooting 1,000 images and not thinking about it. Of course I have spares for that camera and cycle them through the charger when on a vacation. The literature states 500-600 photos on a charge and after a full day of shooting that is probably about right. I purchased a pair of third party batteries on Amazon fairly cheaply and they seem fine.I rarely shoot any video and haven't tried it on the 530, but it's there and in HD.In a direct comparison to a DSLR like the 5D the 530 would hold up fairly well in my opinion in most aspects. Of course the reason to use a DSLR is to have control over the exposure and the 530 has limited `modes' rather than a method to set the exposure directly. The Canon S100 had this ability and I nearly bought it for that reason, intending to add a wifi memory card. When I thought about my true reason for a compact camera, the ability to have a quality camera with me at all times to capture everyday shots, I realized I did not need the control of the S100. For over $100 less the 530 seemed a good buy. Since the 530 includes wifi, that made the s100 another $80 more expensive as I'd have to add it.The only feature I could think of that the 530 was missing is a GPS function that records the location of images. That would have been nice, and some compacts have that, but it wasn't a deal-breaker for me.So, after about a month of trying it in a number of situations I am very pleased with the 530. The camera works as I hoped and the wifi and software for transfer to my iphone work well. I gave up on the image-browser software for the PC as I still use an old version of Canon zoombrowser to transfer to my PC. Imagebrowser seemed very slow as it tried to organize the thousands of image son my PC.

Reviews.Title: Stylish point and shoot camera with great touchscreen and wifi features
Reviews.Author: TMB
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the negative reviews for this camera. I did a lot of research and what appealed to me the most were 1) the size of the camera: it's so compact it fits nicely in my purse or pocket and I had no trouble finding a little case for it. 2) the touchscreen feature: not sure what everyone is complaining about, the touchscreen works great, similar to my iPhone and iPad and a child could figure it out. It's very very simple. You just touch the screen to select what you want and you can cycle through your photos as easily as you can on a smartphone. 3) the wifi option: when I read so many reviews bashing the wifi I was a little skeptical. The good news is that I got the wifi working in 15 minutes. The better news is that I was able to transfer my images onto my iPhone and ipad without needing to use a wifi connection or any cords. There is an Ad Hoc feature that allows you to transfer the photos without the camera or iPhone/iPad being connected to a wifi network. It sort of works like a bluetooth. I was able to transfer images in the car on a long drive back home. No cords, no internet connection.Some other negative points that I've read online have to do with the short battery life and the miniSD card. I have found that neither of these things are an issue. When the battery has gotten low I charge it. It hasn't died on me after a long day of use...so I have no complaints there. The miniSD card is a non issue. I bought an 8GB card for the same price I would have spent on a regular SD card ($12.99). My miniSD came with a full size SD adapter if I needed it, but because of the handy Wifi/Ad Hoc transfer capabilities I never have to take the card out or plug the camera in to transfer my photos.I got this camera so that as a new mom I could take better photos than I do with my smartphone, but I also wanted to be able to share them with other with little or no effort. The images are crisp and clear and the colors are vibrant. I also love the cute/retro boxy look and in matte white the little camera is a unique beauty. I love everything about it and it's yet to disappoint. The macro pictures are amazing as well.I was able to nab this at $199 and for the reasons listed above its way better than some of the other cameras out there at that price point. My mom just got a Nikon and it takes beautiful pics as well but has no touchscreen and no wifi. I'm glad I went with my instinct and got the camera that fits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy the Bundled SD Card
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Camera is awesome, but the bundled SD card under "Frequently Bought Together" doesn't fit. It uses a MicroSD card. Get one of those.

Reviews.Title: Try before you buy.
Reviews.Author: M. Graham
Reviews.Content: I went to local retailer to test run before buying, and I'm glad I did. Between me and the store clerk, we could barely operate the UI touch screen, never mind figure out the Wifi.  Sorry, Canon but this one needs some work.

Reviews.Title: Everybody is right.
Reviews.Author: ceobob
Reviews.Content: All the bad reviews for this camera are pretty much spot on. The touch screen is horrible. So is the battery life. The wifi part of it is kind of difficult to get working. I did get it working with my iphone. I couldn't get any of the other wireless options working though.  The picture quality was not bad. If you like the camera, and do not like the touch screen or the wifi part, there is the Canon Elph 520: Canon PowerShot ELPH 520 HS 10.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 12x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom 28mm Wide-Angle Lens and 1080p Full HD Video Recording (Black). It looks like the same camera as the 530 but without the wifi and touch screen. The 520 is a little cheaper. I am not sure if there are any other differences though. I returned my ELPH 530. However...I just bought the new Panasonic ZS20 which is cheaper than this camera as of this writing, and offers so much more. 20x zoom just to mention one thing. The picture quality of the ZS20 is much better as well. Panasonic Lumix ZS20 14.1 MP High Sensitivity MOS Digital Camera with 20x Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: not sure why others can't get it to work
Reviews.Author: onestopnyc
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a week now and I enjoy it. I already own the Sony NEX 7 but wanted something small enough that didn't have a ringtone. I agree with one reviewer that the white model should not have been matte. It is easy to stain the body with dirty fingers for example. I would use magic sponge to clean it though, just don't get it too wet.Let's be clear, this is not a smartphone when it comes to the touchscreen. The UI is working well for me and responsive. The wifi feature is working well with my iPhone and iPad and since I have photostream on the photos show up on my mac. I have not yet tried to link my camera to the computer. It does take good pictures and so far I am enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: The pictures are good
Reviews.Author: N. Heuer
Reviews.Content: I like the pictures from this camera so far.  The quality is great and the speed to take pictures is not bad.  I have had a new canon camera every year for the past 10 years or so and I was apprehensive of the touch screen.  i had a previous model and didn't like it because of the touch screen.  This one is very usable.  It isn't iOS quality but its pretty decent,  The one problem I noticed immediately is that the on/off button is right next to the view photos button.  I just got the camera and I noticed I am mixing them up and pressing the wrong one often,  I am sure after time I will get this straight but it seems silly to have put them right next to one another.  The size of the camera is really good.  Smallest canon I have had in a while.  People who are complaining about white - buy black - I did.  I wouldn't touch a white camera - ever.  It is going to get dirty.  I don't know if the white one will clean up but it is irrelevant to me.  I don't have white carpet in my house it just won't stay clean.  I am working with the iOS app which is cool but I couldn't get my iPhone and the camera to communicate over the established wifi network.  When it fails you have to re-enter the wifi password- really really bad.  Anyway I connected the camera to the phone with an ad hoc network and I could transfer pictures.  Now the killer: it seems to drain battery quite a bit and if you wanted to select a bunch of pictures you have to select them individually.  I have a 32gig card in this thing and it would take absolutely forever!  I had an eyefi card in my other camera and it was great.  I had high hopes for this wifi system but so far I don't see this as a direct replacement.  I upload my pictures currently to a gallery2 server.  More to come as I discover more about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: Bonnie J. Lauria
Reviews.Content: Before writing my review, I re-read the existing evaluations of the 530 HS.  The opening paragraph written by "ceobob" could have been typed by me!The main reason for this purchase was the Wi-Fi.....What a headache!  The camera takes O.K. photos but the Wi-Fi is next to impossible to set up, I couldnt even get it to work with my I-Phone.  Not being a fan of the touch screen, I did overloked that quandary in favor of the Wi-Fi.  If you are purchasing this product for the Wi-Fi, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PICS, WI-FI WORKS FINE, BATTERY LIFE SHORT
Reviews.Author: GOP2012USA
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and the wi-fi works just fine.Canon will walk you through the wireless setup.The camera's automatic background function is very useful.I agree with other users that the battery life is somewhat short;I bought a 2ndbattery as a backup. If you don't use the Wi-Fi very often, then the battery life is not all that bad. The wireless use, drains the battery, so keep that in mind!One thing I found out, is if you want to transfer pics wirelessly to a PC,you can only do it to a Laptop, since (most) Desktops don't have built inwireless!

Reviews.Title: Shame on you Canon!
Reviews.Author: Greg Romero
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera. Wi-Fi enabled, touch screen, 12x optical zoom, etc, etc. Can't say how disappointed I was after an hour of use. Touch screen is slow, touch screen accuracy was inaccurate, picture quality was no better than the small ELPH I'd been using for years. Canon usually makes terrific products. This one should have stayed on the drawing board a little longer. Tried it a few more days and returned it.

Reviews.Title: Slow UI, Only touch based UI, Body material (White) issue.
Reviews.Author: Jaden P
Reviews.Content: I choose this camera for wifi transfering high quality compact digital camera. Overall picture quality is not bad but not as great as other compact cameras. This camera only support micro SD card for reducing its body size but it is not smaller than my TX10. Basically micro SD card is not fast as regular SD card. UI is a kind of big issue for this camera. It is very slow and hard to touch. iphone or android smart phones touch feeling is absolutely better. LCD is a little past age feeling and hard to touch buttons and all menus are hidden so really need to get used with its menu system.And I don't know black one but this white color camera's material is matted so easy to get dirt or scratch.

Reviews.Title: Battery fast to drain
Reviews.Author: G1
Reviews.Content: This camera comes in a very handy package.  I love the color being white as my favorite one lately but one thing I am a bit frustrated about is the battery life.  It's fast to drain.  Whenever I use it, I always need my back up battery just to keep moving.And another thing, the Wi-fi doesn't seem to be available in different region or some countries.  I am a person who loves to travel and this doesn't seem to function well enough as I expected. I am not just so sure if I need to do some tweaks but that's something I want to learn and still to check.  But overall, I love it just the same.

Reviews.Title: Like the case. The touch screen and image compression needs work
Reviews.Author: Robert Adams
Reviews.Content: I like having a point-and-shoot camera on hand because I find my phone doesn't really replace a real camera. I've had previous versions of PowerShot cameras and, when my last died, I researched around and this camera looked and ideal replacement. Sadly, I returned the camera after a week of testing.I love the chassis. It is small and easy to carry while packing the great optics and the large rear screen. I've always thought a full touch screen would a good design and was excited when I found this design. The packaging of this camera is its best feature.That said, as other reviews have mentioned, the touch screen is slow, unresponsive, and hard to operate. While, on a phone, a quick swipe would change pictures or a touch and drag would change exposure values, this touch panel needs to be firmly touched in just the right place and swiped in just the right way to do its operation. I would suspect that Canon needs to get someone who has done a phone touch screen stack to redo this screen's operation. As it stands, this one is hard to operate.The thing that really lead to two stars, though, is the picture quality. All my pictures seemed fuzzy. I figured I was doing something wrong but after looking and tweaking I believe the JPEG compression or something is just too aggressive. There is no raw picture save mode so everything must be saved as compressed JPEG and, even with the 'super fine' setting, compression artifacts make sky, clouds, flat backgrounds -- things that should be an even color -- fuzzy with a mess of color variation. Edges are not alpha shaded but jaggy with color edge reflections. The problem is aggravated by Canon's choice of not allowing 'super fine' mode when in 'auto' -- it is available in 'program' mode but is not when 'auto'.This picture quality complaint was not reported in other reviews. Maybe my particular purchase was defective or something. I don't know but I'm reporting what I found and why I returned this camera.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen functions are a little difficult to learn
Reviews.Author: James L. Davis
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera a few weeks, and it took some time to learn how to use it. The touch screen functions are quite different from the usual switches, but I am getting used to it. You have to touch the screen fairly hard to select a function, but that is better than being too sensitive.The touch screen appearance is great, and you can see it outdoors, but not with the sun directly on it.A few of my pictures have had poor color, but most are excellent. I believe the poor color has happened when I pushed the button too fast and didn't pause at the halfway position long enough for the software to get the settings right. One evening I shot several pictures indoors with Auto setting, and the automatic flash came on about half the time. On the pictures without flash, the ASA figure went higher. That made the pictures a bit inconsistent for a single event, but almost all were very good.Video is great, and you can zoom while you are shooting. The only video problem I have seen is the stability of the camera. It is so small and lightweight that it is hard to get a good, steady video.I have used the wireless transfer two ways. One way is to transfer through my wireless router. In that case, you connect the camera to the router, and the router is connected to the PC. Another way is to connect directly between the camera and the PC. That works ok, but you have to disconnect the PC from any other wireless, and connect directly to the camera. These connections are both straightforward when you realize there are two ways to connect. It took me a while to realize there are two ways, and not to confuse them. I also set up the camera to transfer to the Canon Image Gateway, a cloud storage service, and that works very well; it does not take long.The battery is small and doesn't last long for wireless transfer, and it may not last long for video, but I haven't shot that much video. I bought a second battery and I alternate batteries, recharging one or both when I am home.I gave the camera only four stars because of the touch screen difficulties and the few pictures that are somewhat off color. That should never happen with a Canon!

Reviews.Title: Good things come in small packages!
Reviews.Author: hskrguy
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Powershot ELPH a few years back. I absolutely loved the photos and the small size, but needed a bigger zoom than the 3X available at that time. I got a Nikon Coolpix with an 18X zoom. Was very happy with that camera until I compared some of the photos with my ELPH. The Canon shots were ALWAYS sharper. I saw this camera with the 12X zoom and had to give it a whirl. I haven't been disappointed. I love taking photos ... but I HATE hauling around camera gear. I love having this little, bitty camera ... essentially the size of a deck of cards that takes crystal clear photos and has a pretty impressive optical zoom built in. The touch screen works well and the wireless capability is cool as well. I must admit I've fought with the wireless interface a little ... but that wasn't a big selling point for me ... so not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Joe Ciccone
Reviews.Content: I have owned dozens of digital cameras ....and this is by far one of the most fun.Canon has always produced cameras. With great options, and that produced terrific photos,But for it's size this one is amazing. My favorite modes are the burst mode, movie and it's slo motion.I haven't even gotten to it's wi-fi features yet, but that wasn't really necessary since it plugs in to yourComputer using included USB cable.

Reviews.Title: O.K. , But it has some issues
Reviews.Author: SysAdmin/Babysitter "SysAdmin/Babysitter"
Reviews.Content: 1- uses Canon batteries only, buy spares if you plan to shoot all day without charging.2- Photo quality is good.3- LCD screen is not so good in BRIGHT daylight.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - especially for the price
Reviews.Author: T&T;
Reviews.Content: Most of user and professional reviews complained the touch screen and Wi-Fi. As a person who started using touch screens from the Palm Pilot era, I have seen planty of worse screens. The touch screen on this camera is actually not that bad. The problem is that Canon just re-uses its regular camera menu system, which was not designed for touch screen. The small icons and arrows definitely make the menu hard to use. However, I think most of the owners will use this camera as a pure point-and-shoot. The touch screen usage should be minimum.Setting up Wi-Fi to connect to iPad takes no time. Connecting to PC is another story. There are many steps that you have to follow and some of them are too technical for most users. To be fair, it is really  Microsoft's fault. Canon does provide detailed step-by-step instructions. Transferring images over Wi-Fi is not fast. It is OK for 10 or 20 pictures. For anything more than that, I would use my card reader. BTW, I do not mind MicroSD card. All our phones use MicroSD cards anyway.So for me, touch screen and Wi-Fi are not the problems. But thanks to all the complains, the price of this camera has dropped dramatically. I pulled the trigger when I saw the price dropped to less than 50% of the MSRP.To achieve the 12x optical zoom in such a small camera, Canon only utilizes 10 MP of the 16 MP sensor (the same idea as Panasonic's extended optical zoom). It means this particular camera uses a even smaller sensor than already small sensor. Because of that, the image quality is not as good as other ELPH cameras. The battery life is not great either. But it could be because I was playing Wi-Fi extensively.I bought this camera for my daughter but I am sure I will use it often too. It is very stylish. The picture quality is not the best, but still good. It has tons of features, but you do not have to use them. Extra battery only costs several dollars. Overall, I am happy with this small camera, especially for the price.[One month ownship follow up:]After the initial "warm up", I only took this camera out twice. The noise level is higher than I would like to see. And the detail level is lower than I would like to see. But the color is very good. As long as we do not view the pictures in pixel level, we should be fine.I was taking some pictures and posting them on internet last night. I have been using memory card readers ever since I started using digital cameras. But taking the small microSD card in and out was a little annoying. Then, I realized this camera has Wi-Fi. No wire no reader, nothing to plug or un-plug, just turn on the Wi-Fi and connect to my computer. The camera appeared on my computer as an extra drive. And I could access all my pictures from there! You have to use this feature to appreciate it.[Another thought]Small image sensor can really impact the image quality and low light performance. This camera's effective sensor is 40% smaller than the Canon's smallest sensor. That certainly will not help. If you still want a ELPH camera, do not care about the block style, do not care about the touch screen, the newly released ELPH 330 HS may be your best choice. It is slightly bigger but lighter than 530 HS. It has an improved Wi-Fi. It does not have touch screen and uses a larger battery. But the most important, the 330 HS uses a full 1/2.3-inch sensor. The image quality should be noticeable better.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures, But
Reviews.Author: Andrea L. Murphy
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is a pain. The camera takes great pictures. I just wish it wasn't a touch screen. Battery drains quick too

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Pen Name?
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about a week and it really is a disappointment. The UI sucks, the quality of the pictures looks like my older camera that I was replacing by buying this one. 10mp are used when in 4:3 mode but when you switch to 16:9 (wide) it goes to 7mp. The white finish will probably get dirty really quickly. The 12X zoom is almost pointless because the quality of the pictures are poor. Micro SD slot it nice for me because I had 16gb cards just laying around in my room. The battery life on this camera is horrible. I transfered a few photos through wifi (to Facebook) after taking maybe like 20 photos and the battery went dead. The videos maybe in 1080P but the image quality is grainy.

Reviews.Title: Does Not Work With Mac OS 10.8
Reviews.Author: Share the Knowledge
Reviews.Content: After considerable frustration trying to get this product recognized by the OS I ended up sending it back. The product may be wonderful, but if it is not recognized by my computer then it does not work for my purposes.

Reviews.Title: Diffuclt to Use
Reviews.Author: shcommish
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 hours trying to get this camera to connect to my computer using the WiFi technology.  Every time it said "Connection Failed".  I am not a tech expert but I do have a lot of experience with digital cameras, computers and smartphones and I have never had as much trouble as this.  My computer is brand new so it can not be because of old computer technology.The touch screen is very difficult to use and does not respond well at all.  I agree with the other reviewer that smartphones and tablets are a lot easier.  You have to really press your finger down and hold it for a couple of seconds before it recognizes the touch.I took the exact same picture with the exact same settings using this camera and my 6 year old Canon camera and my old camera took better pictures than this one.I am a huge Canon fan but this is a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: I finally broke down and bought a camera....
Reviews.Author: jeryan0413
Reviews.Content: I like the camera but I'm disappointed with the battery life and the fact that I can't get the wifi to work. The wifi is what sold me on the camera so I'm disappointed that it's not working. The touchscreen is touchy for sure. The pictures turn out great and I like the style of the camera. It fits great in my back pocket if I'm on the go. I was one of the first to buy the camera after it's release date and I should have waited for the reviews to come out on it. I've been waiting for some time to buy a camera so I'm bummed that I have this one and I made the decision to return it today but the expiration to return it expired on the 6th. I could have gotten a better camera for the money that I spent on it. I buy stuff on amazon all the time...this is the first review I've ever left. I would suggest others to not buy this camera. Canon sure did make a doozy here between the battery life, wifi and the touchscreen.

Reviews.Title: Superb point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Peter Jay M Nieva
Reviews.Content: Very portable. Love the touch screen feature and wifi capability. Eye catcher. Looks very expensive and one of a kind because of it's off white color.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Britton
Reviews.Content: Easy To Use, Small and lightweight, all accessories included, software included easy to follow, battery wasn't charged out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Just as described
Reviews.Author: M. P. Fredrick
Reviews.Content: After checking the reviews and ratings I ordered this for my daughter who loves a separate camera for her pictures instead of just here Nexus 5 cell phone. She loves it and me and my son who do professional camera work are very impressed. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: WIFI doesn't work company said no date in sight for fix
Reviews.Author: Jared Littlehale "Littlebeard"
Reviews.Content: Wifi doesn't work using the APP or mobile device.  I corresponded with the company and they said while they are working on a fix, they have no release date in sight.  Since the WIFI and compatibility with IPAD is the only reason I purchased this camera I will be returning it promptly.  I am rather upset there is no warning about this before purchase because this is apparently a long standing problem.  Perhaps this is why the price is lowered so much?  Well in this case, you don't get what you pay for, you get worse than you pay for, a camera that does not work.I had previously purchased a different canon elph and was satisified, but I will no longer be giving this company my business.  IMO they should have had a voluntary recall since it is useless, the fact that they are still selling it shows me they care more about money than a good product and customer service.

Reviews.Title: Replacement for Aging Early Model Elph
Reviews.Author: dvelosky
Reviews.Content: After learning all the ends and outs of the menu system, which can be rather daunting, I am very happy with this camera. You may have read some scathing reviews about the total on-screen menu system and it is a bear work through, but like anything else once you've made it past the curve it becomes second nature. The options that affect the shot at hand are all there on the screen as you take pictures or video, so it's not like you have to go digging around to take a picture.  The sub-system is the more complicated, but less used set of options.The camera takes excellent pictures and video.  The 10.1 MP results are great for post shooting manipulation, especially cropping.  It's a bit chunky (not clunky) and has some weight to it, which helps stability.  The look and feel of the camera is quality.  It has a lot of versatility, which I like being a DSLR guy, but is perfect for my wife who just wants to take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Count on Canon
Reviews.Author: Goalois
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the size, weight and picture quality of this amazing camera. My iPhone is always with me, so I always have a camera available, but the quality of the shots doesn't begin to compare with the ELPH. For travel, hiking, mountain climbing, outdoor shots or family events, it just does everything very well. And it fits in your shirt pocket. This is my second ELPH. I bought my first one five years ago for a trip to Italy. It still works well, but having a digital zoom and larger screen on this model makes a huge difference. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money.
Reviews.Author: francotexas
Reviews.Content: Difficult to set up. Screen to small and unable to work the WIFI featue.I would have spnt more $$ on a camera.Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: I wish I'd read the fine print, doesn't work with Android
Reviews.Author: michael d collier
Reviews.Content: The only way I can connect the camera to my Android phone is through my wireless network. I like to take a camera to family events and dinner with friends and upload to Facebook. I can do it with other camera, but not this one. I've seen numerous complaints about this, but there seems to be no relief in sight for Android users.

Reviews.Title: Mac Users beware
Reviews.Author: Jean Silva
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is lovely.  However, the digital camera solution disk is not readable in my Mac.  So I have no access to the manual and I am not sure about downloading images.  Haven't found a solution on the Canon website, but I will keep looking.  What a pain.

Reviews.Title: Really nice photos from this camera!
Reviews.Author: LiLi "LiLi"
Reviews.Content: I first used this camera on a trip to Seattle on a cloudy, RAINY weekend.  I took it to a lot of outdoor events in that low-light environment as well as indoor museums.  I gotta say, I am impressed!  The settings on the camera allow for low light, as well as night scenes with low light. The pictures are stunning!Also much faster than my previous camera!The Wifi setup wasn't too hard.  Prob took 30-45 minutes to read through the manual, set up an account online, download the app, and configure the settings on my iPhone.  I did this all prior to the trip.  No issue at all sending my photos to my phone!  Its actually a little magical to see it happen.  I would say though that on my phone (iphone 4) the app you download uses up your cell phone battery much faster, so when I'm not using the app I turn off the background running on the app in my settings.Also, I would recommend buying a backup battery and having it fully charged and with you.  I was using the camera all day in the low light setting and the battery ran out by night time.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality!
Reviews.Author: Rachawadee Patel
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth every penny. I highly recommended if you are always on the go and don't want to miss your memories goes by. This is a great way to connect with facebook as well. Great camera and great quality image.

Reviews.Title: Great pics for such a little camera
Reviews.Author: elena sirbu
Reviews.Content: I like this camera, it's easy to use and I took some pretty amazing pics with it. I didn't expect such good pics for sucha little camera.One thing maybe it's it's size, it's little tiny, so for big man hands it may be a problem.

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: Dl
Reviews.Content: I haven't used the camera enough to have learned all the ins and outs, but so far it is just what I had wxpected.

Reviews.Title: great！
Reviews.Author: Ran Xiang
Reviews.Content: The camera is tiny, it is easy to bring it with me when traveling, just put it in my pocket. The pictures it takes are great! I like the function that when I smile, the camera can automatically take picture for me!

Reviews.Title: ELPH-lover for life!
Reviews.Author: Varda Elentari "Queen of the Stars"
Reviews.Content: This camera meets all of my expectations.  It is everything I want in a point-and-shoot.  It takes beautifully clear photos.  The small size makes it easy to take with me everywhere I go.  The touch screen is easy to operate.  The menu is simple and intuitive.  The special settings are fun and I know I'll get a lot of use from them.  I had an ELPH a few years back, but no camera I've had since then has been as wonderful as this new ELPH is.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Yang Huo
Reviews.Content: It is the first time I write a review on amazon, because this is the exact camera I am looking for.I am a college student who loves to take pictures everywhere I go, this camera is very compact, fashionable, easy to carry everywhere. The touch screen is sometimes slow and stupid, you can't compare it to an Iphone's touch screen, but also, you are not gonna go through the menus all the time, just point and shoot! the picture quality is great!I have not used the wifi feature yet, because I have the card reader, just slide it into my computer and it's all done!Overall, I love the look and feel in my hand, it's so cute :)

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: vivian delk
Reviews.Content: Easy to use!!!! Simple to install software on pc, EASY EASY to upload and share my photos !!! REALLY GREAT photos ! Everything and then some! More than I hoped! Would recommend to everyone and DO!!!

Reviews.Title: Still getting used to it...
Reviews.Author: LucyLucymama
Reviews.Content: It has good features, but I find the touchscreen too touchy in some ways (lots of accidental pics taken) and not responsive enough in others (e.g., multiple touches to delete a pic).

Reviews.Title: Kind of OK product
Reviews.Author: Consumer Joe
Reviews.Content: Camera is small, pictures are good, WiFi makes it easier to transfer pictures from the camera to my Android phone (using a Canon app available free on Googel Play). One problem I have with this camera is that the battery is small and does not last long, especially when using WiFi. The other problem is that it does not print directly to our Cannon Selphy CP900 4x6 printer so I first need to copy the image to my phone (using wifi) and then print it from the phone (again, using wifi).

Reviews.Title: Great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Dee Hosier
Reviews.Content: I really love the pictures this camera takes! It does a wonderful job in all light conditions, with or without flash. It even overcomes my shaky hands and tendency to jerk when I press the shutter. The lens is much better than most of the other point-and-shoot pocket cameras and the 12x optical zoom is another plus.On the downside, battery life is terrible. Be sure to buy a spare and keep one charged at all times. I find myself switching and recharging every time I use the camera.The other con is the wifi. I've never been able to get it to work. But that might just be me...Overall, I'd recommend this camera highly for the quality of the pictures. Just be sure to have a spare, charged-up battery.

Reviews.Title: NOT so great
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is sturdy and looks nice. Big nice screen but the touch control is not great. Needs buttons cause I had to use my nail to change some settings because the arrows etc.. were tiny. But what counts the most in any camera, is the image quality. Well, the quality is BAD. Picture showed in full size are washed out. Not little, but 99% of it. Truthfully, my Samsung Galaxy S3 cell takes better pictures. If you are developing 4x6 photos, it will look decent. But don't expect great quality above that. I had a digital canon PowerShot a few years ago and quality was superb. I just find it odd that as years and technology moves forward, the companies are making the cameras worse (At least the compact point and shoot ones). Either they are using cheap quality lens, materials or they don't want the buyer to have a great camera (Cause there's no need for upgrades then NO if you find a perfect one?). But how can you ask me to upgrade to a newer model and the newer model takes worst pictures then the previous?. Going off topic here. But I'm loosing hope in the small camera department. Now a days, you need to spend over $500 to get a good camera. Anyhow, this camera was not for me.

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Zoilita57
Reviews.Content: Good resolution, good image but I can not connect over Wi-Fi to download photos directly to Facebook and the battery runs out very quickly. Maybe someone can be useful without WI.FI without it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Touch screen is not a good idea
Reviews.Author: Yugandhar Dama
Reviews.Content: Touch screen is not a good idea. Difficult to operate and for some reason I didn't like the picture quality as well.

Reviews.Title: compact, wi-fi, great optical zoom
Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my mother for Christmas. She's so in love with it that she refused to part with it when I asked to borrow it for my vacation! I have owned a few ELPHs and have loved each one. Canons take great, clean photos and the optical zoom on this model is great! The wi-fi feature is so convenient. I can download the photos on my iPad directly from the camera for easy sharing. The touch screen is very handy and the large screen is so convenient!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Makila Fields "bill hendrickson"
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this camera. It takes beautiful pics. and the white is so cool. the paint is matte so it stays fingerprint free. once the setup is complete it is very easy to use. highly suggest it. very fast shipping also.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, but despite numerous tries, I could not get the wifi to work
Reviews.Author: Edward L. Pesanti Jr. "ep"
Reviews.Content: The only reason I decided to replace my perfectly functional Canon Elph was for wifi capabilities - and I can't get that to work.  Despite 2 attempts to change my password on Canon's iMAGE site, I can't even log in.  I suspect the camera is fine, but Canon's web capabilities seem dubious.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Reiniche
Reviews.Content: I have only had this a couple days but so far I like it. I have taken a couple pictures and a short movie clip. They all look great. One word of caution though. I did not see where it said it used a micro-SD card. At the bottom of the ad it said some people also bought.. it showed a 32 GB SD card which I also purchased, It takes a micro-SD card so I could not use it until I got the micro-SD card. That was the only disappointment so far.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Shane
Reviews.Content: Work well n is good value for the money spend. Recommend to buy again in the future. Value for money

Reviews.Title: Help...I cannot get the wifi to work on anything even in myown home on my private wifi
Reviews.Author: Connie Logg "inetmom"
Reviews.Content: I cannot get it to work with wifi...neither my computer windows 8.01, my ipad 5 or my iPhone 5 ..what is wrong..I bought it because of wifi...but can not get it to work with anyof them

Reviews.Title: Happy with my choice of this Canon Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: P. D. Beverleigh
Reviews.Content: My last camera finally died on me and I wasn't sure what to buy because there are so many choices out there.  I just did a lot of research and found that this seemed to be the camera for me.  They have a great reputation and it's very easy to use.  I'm sure I will have many years of use with this camera.

Reviews.Title: No wifi
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wifi is very difficult to setup. I am technical savy but could not do it. Never could use wifi which was prime reason to buy

Reviews.Title: Camera  does'nt Work properly!
Reviews.Author: Glen Evans
Reviews.Content: Pictures are blurred! Camera does'nt focus right! I wish I had'nt bought this camera, not a good deal at all!

Reviews.Title: A small camera but it does a lot!
Reviews.Author: Wausa 58
Reviews.Content: My husband had to help me figure out how to work it, but we printed the instruction book and that was helpful.  It's truly amazing what all it does - slow motion, great pictures, and great movies.  I find the battery doesn't last as long as I would like, but I just plug in the charger and it's ready to go in a short time.

Reviews.Title: Battery (almost)dead on arrival
Reviews.Author: I really bought it for myself
Reviews.Content: Infuriatingly, the battery died after being fully charged and our taking two pictures within a month after we got the camera.Also be aware that this camera has a smaller ("mini") memory card than previous versions, so you have to buy new memory cards to use it. (To put the memory card into your computer, you have to use a tiny adapter....which you have to keep track of.)The touch screen is annoying and not intuitive.Not happy with the camera and furious that we had to order a new battery for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price!!
Reviews.Author: Kyle McCanney
Reviews.Content: Good every day camera...zoom is amazing.  Touch screen is hard to get used to but works its not a cell phone so you can't expect it to respond like one!!!

Reviews.Title: nice camera but the battery is very bad.
Reviews.Author: Manchen Brown
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice overall with you expected on Canon. But the battery does not last long at all, even without using wifi. I went out for a  couple hours and it is out. It is really not realistic at all if it can not even last for a day.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Charles Lathrop
Reviews.Content: Have a lot of learning to do. Connecting to WiFi will take some time. Takes good pictures  word word word

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: NB
Reviews.Content: Has met all expectations, and takes relatively good pics.Would prefer maybe more pixels, longer battery life, and for it not to use microSD card.....but overall a very nice camera and would most likely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: V. Beja
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. My other one was not working anymore and I wanted something that had a good zoom and was easy to operate.  The only issue I have is with the review of the pictures, the touchscreen has to be touched hard sometimes.  Zoom is great.  Also, I still need to figure out a better way to delete from the memory chip.  Also, they should advertise that you need to purchase a micro-SD card for the camera.  It held me up a bit until I could get to the store to purchase. Otherwise it is great.

Reviews.Title: Quality Camera and Very Good Pictures/Video
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I did without a camera for about a decade. My previous camera was a Poloroid Spectra, about the best instant gratification one could get in the 1990's.Not only does this camera show the current image on the 3.2" LCD, it has a touch screen as well. I have been using the camera for photos and video for five months now, and am getting excellent results. The included software though, stops at photos and offers little video support. I recommend using Nero Platinum for its photo browser and video support. You can mix photos and video in a slide show, then export to your hard drive or make a DVD in about an hour, including transferring of photo/video files.The zoom feature (up to 12X optical, 48X with digital) works pretty smoothly and makes for some great photos or videos (1080p).I shot some concert video from 35 feet away and it looked like I was 6 to 8 feet away - in complete darkness except for the stage lights. Some say the zoom is a little grainy, but the optical alone does not cause that. Only if you go over 12 times zoom does the digital kick in. I have a picture of the moon which shows a little "noise", but I also shot some lillies and it came out amazing !.I highly recommend this camera for personal use.

Reviews.Title: Great portable camera
Reviews.Author: stefano sanvito
Reviews.Content: Cheap but smart. This camera fits your jeans trousers but can take bright and shaped photos in every light condition.Many (even too much) shot programs may help you in every condition.Wi-fi connection but has no gps unit.10 mega-pixel sensor may appear too small but it's good enough if you're not a professional user (and you may look at EOS cameras)

Reviews.Title: best small camera on the market all things considered
Reviews.Author: Don Lanpher
Reviews.Content: I like it....The size....the ease of operation.....I should have gotten the small case with it .....great photos and zoom lense.....  all in a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: Not able to download disc...
Reviews.Author: Walter G. Hannig
Reviews.Content: I returned this camera after not being able to down load software from dics.  I talked with Canon's technical people too.  I mentioned that I had and older Canon (six years or so) and the said  the existing solfware would work...I wanted the updated software and returned the camera.  Be carefull.

Reviews.Title: NICE CAMERA
Reviews.Author: ERNEST WASHINGTON
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice camera, but it's a little bit complicated. I had to read the manual, but have never done that before. The battery life is a little short, but other then that the pictures and video is really clear and nice.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom
Reviews.Author: R. H. Downing
Reviews.Content: the camera takes really good pictures, zoom is very good for a small camera. I have been having trouble using it however because it is so small. I keep hitting the "review" button it is too close to the trigger button. I am sure I will get used to it, and grow to love it. The size is great for pocket.

Reviews.Title: Would pay extra money for an optical view finder
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Overall, I love the camera. Nice form factor and features. The touch screen works pretty well. The 12x zoom is good. But, I miss my optical zoom. I would pay an extra $100 or more for a camera with the same features as this camera if it had an optical view finder also. I have a hard time seeing the touch screen while shooting outside.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING zoom!
Reviews.Author: RKS44
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed by how great the zoom on this camera is! I was looking for a small, compact camera to carry with me as I travel Europe and the Middle East since I don't want it to be stolen. This will be great for all of the sites I will see! I was hoping to get an SLR camera but it was just too clunky for my needs. I researched many different cameras and felt that I was getting the most for my money with this one. I am officially a Canon fan! The touchscreen is great! I am an iPhone user and don't have any complaints about the touchscreen feature. The pictures are just so so beautiful! Night pictures turn out great too! At my boyfriend's graduation, his family all used iPhones to take pictures and their photos weren't coming out well since it was a bit cloudy and grey w/ a little rain. We used this camera and his sister said something like, "and this is why we shouldn't rely on phone cameras. Cameras are still so useful today." My only concern is that the back screen will get scratched up, so buy a screen protector for that! And sometimes it feels a little boxy--I wish they had flattened it out more and made it thinner and wider. Nevertheless, I LOVE it and would recommend it to anyone! (PS the videos turn out really great too!)

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: By far the best camera I've ever had. Super small, Fits in your pocket, Super easy and customizable. It can be as good as a DSLR, If you know how to use it. Records in MOV format, Harder to edit, but quality is PERFECTION

Reviews.Title: great canon love it
Reviews.Author: patricia knott
Reviews.Content: Love the camera need one for taking up close jewerly pictures does a great job even has a battery that is rechargeable so no more buying AAA batteries love this one.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Lady of the cove.
Reviews.Content: I was on a tour with pro photographers.  I couldn't work all the shots they did but I took really good memorable pics and wasn't weighed down by 45 lbs. of equipment.

Reviews.Title: Love this. Just wish I could transfer full resolution to my phone
Reviews.Author: Shelley Bevacqua
Reviews.Content: Quality photos again ! I tried living with mediocre pics from my Iphone 5and Android phone. It's convenient to use just one gadget, but at the price of quality. Tried out this camera at a house party and uploaded beautiful snaps to Facebook. It is not hard to set up a wi-fi connection from the camera to the phone. There's just a 5 second delay until the two gadgets are connected.I use the ad hoc route. I don't bother with the PC. The only downfall isthat the image transferred to the phone is only 2 mp versus the full 10 mpresolution. But 2 mp quality is still superior to 8 mp noisy photo.

Reviews.Title: Small and powerful!
Reviews.Author: PatsyPepper
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a point-and-shoot camera to keep in my purse and Canon ELPH 530 HS fits the bill perfectly!It fits pockets and purses with ease and delivers great pictures for end users.The touch screen display might be tricky to use, specially for those who - like me - have fat fingers, but the wrist strap comes with a stylus-like tip that is really useful.The wi-fi setup is not as intuitive as it could be and considering I am usign this camera in Brazil, I cannot enjoy th benefits of Canon Image Gateway,  so I am not able to post my pictures directly to social networks such as Facebook. However, I can connect the cam just fine to my phone and my computer, thus not needing any cables.The sensor is not jam packed with MPixels, turning the pictures sharper and less grainy than most cameras in this price range.From a home user POV, it is a winner!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: J. Kremer
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use.  Too many "fancy features" that I can't imagine really using.  Actually its a problem that, with the big storage  card, I can take more movies than I can download on a freshly charged battery, and there is no way to plug the camera in while downloading.  This means I have to do it manually, guessing how many pics/movies I can grab before I have to stop and recharge.  Strange but true...

Reviews.Title: Above average
Reviews.Author: Krishna
Reviews.Content: Overrally good.  But missing the panorama feature.we cannot change the modes fastly as it is touch based.pros - sleek, light weight, wireless connectivitycons - option setting is slow due to full touch

Reviews.Title: Usual Good Quality from Canon
Reviews.Author: R. H. Newmark "BobN"
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how small the camera was but what wonderful pictures it takes. We had some issues getting to work with our Android device but if you go to Canon's web site and follow the very simple step by step procedure it does work.I am thinking of buying one or two more to give as gifts.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Black
Reviews.Content: My first digital camera and it was well worth it. Touch screen and all. I love it. The wireless connection is cool because I download pics right to my cell or computer.

Reviews.Title: its alight
Reviews.Author: hector
Reviews.Content: camera is ok but not my cup of tea. touch screen is slow and the only way to navigate the camera is thru touch screen so go figure. oh yea Sd card not included.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: jenny lorena chamorro
Reviews.Content: Doy esta calificación porque Cumplió con todas mis expectativas, en calidad, cumplimiento de entrega y muy buen precio, súper recomendable

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: DIY Husband
Reviews.Content: Exceptional capability for a such a lightweight, compact camera. This is my 3rd Cannon ELPH. I had an SD1000 for years, then gave it to my wife. When my Nikon Coolpix L810 zoom jammed on a cruise to Antarctica, I bought a 520HS on the ship. I bought the 530HS for my wife, to give her the same capability. We use them mostly for travel, cruising, touring & sightseeing. The 12x optical zoom and image stabilization are amazing. It's a little unstable at maximum 48x zoom, but I just lean against a rail or pole. The 530HS is essentially the same as the 520HS, but with digital touch screen controls. The only real problem I have is the network interface isn't compatible with my Windows operating systems: Vista on my desktop; Win 7 Starter on my netbook.

Reviews.Title: Mixed Emotions
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Duong
Reviews.Content: First off I think the price that I paid (Lighting Deals) was quite fair. However it's normal price wouldn't be fair. This camera zoom resolution is actually quite amazing given it's so tiny. From my house to down the block roughly 100 feet, I can zoom into a Ford F150 and read the small tiny words underneath the F-150 badge, and it's super clear. However, the screen is way too small and the camera itself is way too small. It doesn't come with any SD card. The battery runs out fast.Other than that, the installing is quite easy, as with anything else.

Reviews.Title: OUTSTANDING
Reviews.Author: BADER
Reviews.Content: It is a high quality compact digital camera and you can feel the quality at the time of unboxing it , This product is made in JAPAN and there is no doupt on quality.

Reviews.Title: It's Okay
Reviews.Author: DA
Reviews.Content: The quality of the photos is pretty good, comparable to other canon powershots, but there were a lot of things that I didn't like. The shutter cover doesnt look like it will protect the lens so I worry for its safety.  The camera did not come with a memory card, and has no internal memory, so you have to provide a microsd.  I selected this camera for its wifi capabilities but I have not been able to get it to work. I'm pretty tech-savy, so its definitely not an easy step by step process. In my research so far, I believe it requires installation of software on the computer and setting it up through there, but that hasn't worked yet.  The battery is different than many of the other powershot cameras - this one uses the provided nb-9l.  The touch screen took some getting used to, but works ok.  The flash options are auto and off. There is no permanent "on" flash option.  I would probably exchange it for something else if I haven't run out of time.

Reviews.Title: canon camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Diaz
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for the wifi. I love the feature but the camera is a little slow. It is okay but not what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Canon get out of touchscreen tech. You don't know how to do it
Reviews.Author: Freesoul
Reviews.Content: I was sold for the 12x zoom in a small portable package and canon reputation quality. That's why I didn't make much research but I never thought Canon could make such an horrible product when it comes to touch screen. The resistive screen is far behind the level smartphones have come today and it's obvious that canon didn't bother to invest in this technology.The wifi connection doesn't support direct upload to fb or picasa unlike the recent Samsungs that have this handy feature and it doesn't support Android phones so you will also have to buy an Iphone if you want to use it transferring your files to your smart phone. Shame on you Canon for giving us such an unrefined product.  Image Quality is really good but what's the point if the battery will die half way and you can't use it the way you want because of the unresponsive screen.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: lll
Reviews.Content: My friens recommended me to buy this item. I like it. I will try to use it as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Dana Rainwater
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures. The Zoom is fantastic. It Has so many features I still have not learned to use yet,

Reviews.Title: amazing camera with extra features
Reviews.Author: Mr. Do it All
Reviews.Content: I go to shoot with this camera last week. the picture quality is solid thanks to Canons new HS SYSTEM and Digic 5 cmos sensor.  10X optical for me is a must over the usual 3 or 5x optical and so the elph 530 comes through their as well.The built in wifi is also a huge plus for me becasue it makes syncing and sharing photos via my pc easier. I have not had a chance to play with the high speed AF just yet but I am excited to give it a try. 1080P video is another must for me on a point and shoot.  the touch screen is a bit gimmicky but nonetheless is a cool and sometimes useful feature.Overall just another rock solid powershot from canon.

Reviews.Title: Still learning
Reviews.Author: little grannie
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, but I am still learning all the ins and outs of how to run it and get it to do all the things I want to do with it.  But yes, I do like the camera.

Reviews.Title: One for the consumer, great camera!
Reviews.Author: Walter Wilczak
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot ELF is easy to use, small enough that it fits in your pocket, great for movies, still pictures and action shots!I recommend this camera to anyone who enjoys taking pictures.

Reviews.Title: 530 PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am a senior but I do like electrical gadgets.  I like the camera but I have yet to figure out why the camera and my computers will not connect on my wireless.  The LCD menu is hard to use and the logic used so you can use the menu does not work well for me.  I found the it hard to get to the items I needed to get to.  The manual was very basic.

Reviews.Title: Good but cannot belive new one.
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to buy this. And finally I bought this. I was happy. However I tried to connect my computer, I figured out it's not new one. Because there was some others name input there. The name is "tobi". Hum... I don't know who is tobi and what is "tobi's mac book"...Is it usually happened??? The box is new one. But I can't belive it is newone. It seems newone. But I think someone used and retured and they resaled... now, it's over 30days. So I cannot return, but if you want to buy this you have to think about this even amazon prime!!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding, but NO MEMORY CARD INCLUDED????
Reviews.Author: resmitty
Reviews.Content: Can't believe Canon didn't include any memory card at all, making camera unusable until I was able to get one.  Lost several days after getting camera.  This is really tacky.  My last Canon (S2, 12x zoom) had a very minimal card (16mb), but at least it had one.  I made mistake of assuming (ass/u/me per old saying/breakdown of word)...  I love the camera and all it's features.  Still have to explore the WFII capability, set this up so I can download photos to my computers without connecting USB cable (but this is easy too).  The ELPH 510 was one of top four rated by Consumer Reports, and I compared all and searched for prices.  Learned the 520 was out, an upgrade of 510, then found 530 (a 520 with WFII for only about $10 more).  Best price was Amazon, even Vs Sams or Costco (with a coupon), but had problems finding exact models rated by CR.After about 6 years, my Canon S2 has begun to have trouble focusing reliably.  Images are sometimes dull too, so wonder if CMOS  cells are getting dusty.

Reviews.Title: No Memory Card
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: Why is there no memory card included??????? The picture looks and great features. Wifi on a camera is great. I boulght a memory card, had to.

Reviews.Title: ELF
Reviews.Author: Ric Mac
Reviews.Content: Make sure you buy a digital card, one is NOT supplied. Would think amazing AMAZON would tell you that ...?

Reviews.Title: not good touch ddddddddddddddddddd
Reviews.Author: Sal@EZAutoleasing
Reviews.Content: its a bad cam not good touch its just good for fun and its a bunch of junk thanks :(
